## Data
```{r}
# check distribution of variables

# distribution of dependent variable - race
ggplot( data = df, aes( x = race ) ) +
  geom_histogram( fill = 'dodgerblue3', bins = 2 ) +
  labs( x='\n Number of registered deaths', y='Absolute Frequency \n',
       title= 'Distribution of number of registered deaths by country') +
  theme_light() +
  theme( panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(), 
        plot.title = element_text( size = 12, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5 ) )

ggplot( data = df, aes( x = race, fill = race ) )  +
  geom_bar( ) +
  labs( x = '\n Race of Awardees', y = 'Number of Awardees \n',
        title = 'Distribution of Best Actor Awardees by Race (1929-2014)') +
  scale_fill_manual( values = c( '#c7006b', 'dodgerblue3' ), name = 'Race' ) +
  theme( panel.grid.minor.x = element_blank(), 
         plot.title = element_text( size = 12, face = "bold", hjust = 0.5 ) ) +
  scale_x_discrete( breaks = 1:2, labels = c( 'White', 'Not White' ) )
```
